  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The 5 gallon plastic pail was discovered leaking and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The plastic pail of ZEP Industrial Purple Degreaser is cracked causing it to leak. About 20 ounces were released. No shipping box or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the leaking package it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

After finding the bottom of the plastic pail cracked it was moved into a tote for temporary storage. When the package arrived at the hazardous materials cage it was moved into a salvage drum. DescribePack: Crack is on the bottom lip of the pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Swept up loose materials and placed in salvage drum

item.title: Report E-2024020123
item.description:
Report E-2024020123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: Tampa
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/3/2024, at 0230 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yoeman Yard, in Tampa, Florida, reported tank car RCRX 2714, load, hydrochloric acid, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Daikin America, Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0203-00008). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Josh Dearing, a CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials, were dispatched to the scene. Response personnel found that 1 of 4 liquid line closure flange bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel properly tightened the liquid line closure flange bolts and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Scott Missildine, 256-476-8009). Additionally, response personnel verified proper securement of all other closure bolts on the tank car’s service equipment, removed hazardous residue from the exterior of the car, and applied a mild neutralizing agent to the car’s surface prior to releasing the car for transportation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Alka-brite coil cleaner 1-gallon had loose lid resulted to leakage. The seal beneath lid was wet & corroded resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. The seal beneath lid was wet & corroded resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

The foil seal beneath lid was wet & torn allowing leakage. Leakage wet & stained other 3 bottles but undamaged. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. The foil seal beneath lid was wet & torn allowing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in a trailer from the unload, when the package handler noticed the smell of chlorine and white powder coming out of the box at 9:30 a.m. The package handler immediately reported the package to QA. QA then moved the package away from the unloaders and put it in a red tote. DescribePack: Package failed at the cap of the container which cracked opened due to not enough interior support for the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package from the unloaders

item.title: Report X-2024020820
item.description:
Report X-2024020820

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived to the station already wet and torn, upon discovery it was placed in a hazmat bag and then hazmat bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All four bottles of StatLab Decal stat arrived with loose caps and each lost about 2.5 ounces of liquid totaling 10 ounces. Upon inspection the caps were loose and even the seal underneath was compromised which allowed liquid to seep out and spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival the wet package was discovered and immediately set aside in a hazmat bag and hazmat bin for further containment. No further release was found

item.title: Report I-2023110059
item.description:
Report I-2023110059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-24T00:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIJET HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Undeclared dangerous goods material. On 11-15-2023, AWB# 810-20766955 was transfered by highway to Amerijet MIA from ATL to KIN. The shipment contained 2 packages with a gross weight of 70 kg. Piece #1 contained 12 cans of UN2037, and piece #2 contained UN3528 in the form of a generator. The packages were discovered during routine CBP inspections and then reported. The Amerijet Dangerous Goods team inspected the shipment and confirmed the presence of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment was placed on hold in the dangerous goods hold area.
